Chogha Zanbil (Persian: چُغازَنبیل) is an ancient Elamite complex in the Khuzestan province of Iran.

The city stretches out a lot so you might want to use a savari to get to the Arg-é Bam.

value: The main attraction, the ancient citadel of Arg-é Bam, suffered badly in an earthquake in December 2003. Today little is still to be seen and access is extremely restricted; there is only one main access path still open to the public and the castle on top of the hill is out of bounds.
The ancient citadel of Tchogha Zanbil probably has a history dating back around 2500 years,
